items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
High tides this morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today, Wednesday 05 November. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels may remain high over the next couple of days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Coastal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 05 and 06 November 2025.   Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:- Leintwardine 1.2m-1.3m 05/11 PM.  We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 6.33 metres Chart Datum (3.28 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Small amounts of water will flood land and fields at Climping. Waves will overtop the sea front, directing water westwards along Mill Lane (from the right of the East car park) towards properties on Climping Street. Water may pond near property and in Climping Street Car Park. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 17 cm lower (3.11 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 06/11/2025.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 5:15pm to 10:15pm on 05/11/25. 
High tides this afternoon and early evening may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible from 5:15pm to 10:15pm on 05/11/25 due to particularly high spring tides with Force 4 or 5 south easterly winds. Areas most at risk include Castletown, Weymouth, Preston Beach, Swanage Bay, Studland Bay, Sandbanks, Poole Harbour, Bournemouth Beach, Hengistbury Head and Christchurch Harbour. In Swanage there may be a risk to the lower end of High Street road by the Pier Head so avoid parking vehicles in this area due to wave overtopping and flying debris. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads and low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.2 m. Total forecast tide is 5.33 metres Chart Datum (2.59 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. The tide will flood Shore Road. At Bosham High Street, water will be near to or flood front door steps. Gardens or land of shore side properties around the Harbour could also be affected. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 21 cm lower (2.38 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 06/11/2025.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
 
Flooding is possible over the high tides from Wednesday 5th to Friday 7th November.
 
Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks, and harbours may be flooded. Areas particularly at risk include exposed coastal areas of Plymouth Sound, Cawsand, Kingsand, The Hoe, Millbrook & low lying areas on estuaries. High tide at Plymouth on Wednesday is at 5:21pm and Thursday at 5:44am. Forecast total high tide level is 2.97mAOD and 2.93mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.4m above tide table level. Force 3 to 4 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 2.6m are forecast. Tides of most concern are Wednesday evening and Thursday morning.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded. 
 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal areas of Littlehampton Rope Walk
items.message: High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 6.33 metres Chart Datum (3.28 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Water will be high up slipways and could flood roads through drains. If the tide comes in a little higher than we are predicting, a small amount of water could flow through The Shipyard and Boat Yards, and onto Rope Walk. With shallow depths of water potentially affecting properties of, and near, North Park. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 17 cm lower (3.11 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 06/11/2025.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:57pm to 10:57pm on 05/11/25. 
Areas most at risk include Poole Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Frome and River Piddle. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Poole of 1.41 mAODN at 8:57pm which is 0.37m above tide tables with south easterly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 6/11/25 between 07:18am and 11:18am with a peak level of 1.41 mAODN at 09:18am with southernly force 5 winds. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads and low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Gribbin Head to Rame Head
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next three days may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Wednesday the 5th to Friday the 7th of November. 

Spray and wave overtopping of low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas at risk include Fowey, Lostwithiel, Polperro Harbour, Looe, Millendreath and the B3247 at Seaton. High tide at Plymouth on Wednesday is at 5:21pm and 5:44am on Thursday. Forecast total high tide levels are 2.97mAOD and 2.93mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.4m above tide table level. Force 4 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.6m are forecast over Wednesday pm tide, easing to Force 3 South Easterly and offshore wave heights of 1.8m on Thursday am tide. A Flood Warning is in force. Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday pm tide.  

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Wednesday 5th to Friday 7th November  

Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks, and harbours may be flooded. Areas particularly at risk include Swanpool, St Mawes, East Portholland, Mevagissey, and Par. High tide at Falmouth on Wednesday is 4:46pm and on Thursday is 5:06am. Forecast total high tide level is 2.85mAOD and 2.76mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.3m above tide table level. Force 4 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.5m are forecast over Wednesday pm tide, easing to Force 3 Easterly and offshore wave heights of 1.8m on Thursday am tide. A Flood Warning is in force. Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday pm tide.   

We are closely monitoring the situation .  

Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded .  

This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 17:45 to 19:45 this evening and 06:15 to 08:15 tomorrow morning 
The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Avonmouth. The first forecast high water is at  18:45 on 05/11/2025 with a level of 7.57 mAODN with  Easterly force 4 winds. winds. The second forecast high water is at  07:15 on 06/11/2025 with a level of 7.57 mAODN with South Easterly force 3 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.) 
Further flooding is possible until Friday Evening due to high spring tides. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:45PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 7:15pm to 11:15pm on 05/11/25. 
Locations most affected will be Bridge Street, Stoney Lane and Monkswell Gardens in Purewell and Christchurch Harbour. Areas most at risk include tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a high water level of 1.37 mAODN at 9:15pm this evening with south easterly force 5 winds. The second forecast high water is at 09:36am tomorrow morning with a level of 1.39 mAODN with southernly force 4 winds (mAODN is height above average sea level). Flooding is possible 2 hours either side on the high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message: The weather forecast is turning more settled for a time compared with recent days.  River levels are falling but larger water bodies such as Coniston will remain high into the weekend.  We continue to monitor the situation.  Do not walk or drive through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 6th November 2025.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of high tides between Wednesday evening and Friday evening. 
Areas particularly at risk include Lynmouth, Combe Martin, Hele, Ilfracombe, Lee, Instow, Appledore, Westward Ho!, and Clovelly, Bideford, Barnstaple.
  
High tide at Ilfracombe is at 5:30PM on Wednesday 5th and 6:00AM on Thursday 6th November, times of high water will vary along the coast.  Forecast total high tide levels are 5.23mAOD and 5.17mAOD respectively, both of which are 0.32 metres above tide table level.  Force 3 to 4 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 1.7m are forecast over the high tides.

Coastal conditions should ease for Saturday morning's high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:30PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high. Flooding is possible on over the next two days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech peaked at 4.26m 05/11 AM. Cae Howel 3.0m – 3.2m 05/11 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions this afternoon may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of high tide from Wednesday 5th November evening until Friday evening.

Areas particularly at risk include communities within the Kingsbridge, Dart and Teign estuaries.

The high tide at Plymouth are at 5.30PM on Wednesday 5th November and 5.45AM on Thursday 6th, times of high water will vary along the coast. Forecast total high tide levels are 2.96mAOD and 2.92mAOD respectively, which are up to 0.39 metres above tide table level. Strong force 3 to 4 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 2.50m are forecast over the high tide.

Coastal conditions should ease for Friday evening's high tide.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 12:30PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

High tides overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 23:00 hrs on 05/11/2025 at the following locations: 
Fiddlers Ferry, peaking around 23:45
Eastford Road, peaking around 00:00
Arpley Bridge, peaking around 00:15
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge.
We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts/warnings. We are liasing with emergency services and local authorities.

We do not anticipate flooding for the afternoon tides on 05/11/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation  
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 10:45AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the coast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation .and closing flood gates where necessary. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from 22:15 to 23:30 on 05 November 2025. The following high tide at 11:15 on 06 November 2025 will also reach flood alert level.

Locations most affected will include Tiger's Tail, Wyre Dock, Burrow's Marsh, Burn Naze, Thornton, Trunnah, Stanah, Poulton-le-Fylde, Skippool, Hambleton, Cold Row, Little Singleton, Little Eccleston and Crow Woods.

We are within a cycle of high tides. Flood alerts for the Wyre Estuary are likely to remain in force until Saturday 08 November 2025.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 09:00 on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
Higher than normal tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 05:15 to 06:00 on 06/11/2025. 
Locations affected will be the North Sea coast from Mappleton to Spurn Point and in particular around Spurn Road. We are experiencing a series of high spring tides. This alert may be reissued as a result for subsequent tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal footpaths, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

River levels remain high and may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 05 and 06 November 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay on Wye peaked at 3.0m 05/11 AM, Bredwardine peaking around 4.7m on 05/11 PM, Belmont peaking around 4.8m on 05/11 PM, Old Wye Bridge 4.1m to 4.2m on 05/11 PM, Mordiford 4.2m to 4.3m on 06/11 AM, Ross on Wye 3.6m to 3.9m on 06/11 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Eden at Carlisle, Rickerby Park, Swifts and Stoneyholme Golf Courses
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. The rainfall this morning will cause an increase in the river levels but we are not expecting them to reach the flood warning threshold again. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. Rain this morning will cause the rivers to respond and remain high through to tomorrow, Thursday 06 November 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 05 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Townfield Lane may be cut off. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides are expected to cause flooding on Thursday. 
Flooding is expected for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 10:45 on 06/11/2025 and 13:00 on 06/11/2025.   
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 4.08 metres Chart Datum (2.32 mAOD) at Beaulieu. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Palace Lane and the B3056 (Hatchet Lane) north of the Mill Pond will flood. Access to the village will be temporarily difficult. On the downstream side of the pond, the Mill House garden will flood. Thursday's tide at 23:00 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 17 cm lower (2.15 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 06 November 2025 1.5 hours before, and 3.5 hours after the tide at 10:45. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 5.26 metres Chart Datum (2.52 mAOD) at Southampton. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Levels in the lower River Itchen will increase as the incoming tide prevents water from flowing out to sea. Footpath flooding will affect some areas of Riverside Park. The pub car park at Mansbridge, may see minor impact flooding for a short period of time. Any flood depth would be relatively shallow. The tide will not flood property or the A27. Thursday's tide at 23:00 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.33 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 10:45 on 06/11/2025 and 13:00 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 5.26 metres Chart Datum (2.52 mAOD) at Southampton. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Minor flooding will affect the lower floor of Eling Tide Mill and Eling Lane. Road and car park flooding will occur at Ashlett Creek (Fawley), Woodmill Lane, the Quay and Ropewalk (Hamble), Rising Sun Pub (Warsash), Magazine Lane (Marchwood), Shore Road (Hythe). Water will come close to property nearest the estuary at Testwood and boat yards at Bursledon. Thursday's tide at 23:00 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.33 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.28 m. Total forecast tide is 5.41 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Levels will be high at South Street and Queen Street Emsworth. The Ship Inn car park, Langstone will flood. Water will flow across the A259 junction with Lumley Road, flooding driveways. Road flooding will affect Langstone High Street. Depth of flood water in roads will be up to 0.2m. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.49 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 10:56 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 4.79 metres Chart Datum (2.20 mAOD) at Cowes. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Flooding of sea front roads, esplanades and car parks is expected. Water levels will be very high in Cowes, affecting Medina Road (floating bridge) and Sea Street (Newport). In East Cowes, very minor impacts are expected at Albany Road, Well Road, York Avenue and Castle Street. The ferry terminal car park at Yarmouth will flood. Thursday's tide at 23:11 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.01 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall Coast from Lands End to Lizard Point
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next three days may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Wednesday 5th to Friday 7th November  

Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas particularly at risk include Newlyn, Penzance, Porthleven and Longrock. High tide at Newlyn on Wednesday is at 4:09pm and on Thursday morning at 4:31am. Forecast total high tide level is 3.23mAOD and 3.18mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.4 metres above tide table level. Force 3 or 4 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of around 3m are forecast. High tides of most concern are Wednesday afternoon and Thursday morning.  

We are closely monitoring the situation .  

Avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded .  

This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from Lands End to Chapel Porth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible over the high tides on the evening of Wednesday 5 November and morning of Thursday 6 November. 
Areas particularly at risk include low lying coastal locations including St Ives Harbour, Portreath Harbour and the Causeway at Hayle.
The high tide at St Ives on Wednesday evening is at 16:40 and at 05:01 on Thursday morning. 
Forecast total high tide level is 4.08mAOD on Wednesday PM and 4.02mAOD on Thursday AM. 
Expect tide levels along the coast to be up to 0.5m above tide table level. Strong Force 5 south-easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.3m are forecast over the high tide.
Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday PM tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
The previous tide of concern has now passed,  the weather is more settled and no flooding is expected. However we are expecting to issue another flood alert for high tide at Clacton for tomorrow morning tide. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 4:12pm to 8:12pm on 05/11/25. 
Areas most at risk include West Bay Harbour and the tidal stretch of the River Brit. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at West Bay of 2.60 mAODN at 6:12pm which is 0.36m above tide tables, with southernly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 06/11/25 between 04:39am and 08:39am with a peak level of 2.62 mAODN at 06:39am with southernly force 4 winds. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 5pm today 05/11/25 and tomorrow morning from 6am, 06/11/25 
A series of high tides is due over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow. Predicted peaks:- Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m this evening, 05/11/25, Newport 6.9m to 7.3m this evening , 05/11/25. Tomorrow morning's high tide is forecast  between 6 and 7am, 06/11/25, predicted peaks :- Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m, Newport 7.1 m to 7.3m. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: North Cornwall Coast, Tidal Camel Estuary

items.message:
High tides over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible over the high tides on the evening of Wednesday 5 November and morning of Thursday 6 November. 
Areas particularly at risk include low-lying land, roads and carparks, particularly at Little Petherick.  
The high tide at Padstow on Wednesday evening is at 16:52 and at 05:12 on Thursday morning.  
Forecast total high tide level is 4.60mAOD on Wednesday PM and 4.50mAOD on Thursday AM.  
Expect tide levels along the coast to be up to 0.5m above tide table level. Strong Force 5 south-easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 2.3m are forecast over the high tides. 
Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday PM tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Irish Sea from Hilbre Island to Heswall
items.message:
High tides overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible between 22:00 and 00:00 on 05.11.2025. 
The current forecast shows we are likely to see spray overtopping during the midnight high tide tonight, (05.11.2025). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 4:50PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

High river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 05 and 06 November 2025.  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bankfull at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Predicted peaks:- Crew Green 5.5m to 5.7m on 05/11 PM, Montford 4.4m – 4.7m on 06/11 AM, Welshbridge 2.2m – 2.5m on 06/11 PM, Buildwas 3.0m – 3.5m on 07/11 AM.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from St Margaret's at Cliffe to Sandgate
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 08:45am to 12:45pm on 6 November 2025. 
Flooding will be localised and low lying land near the coast is expected to be most affected, particularly around Dover, Folkestone and St Margaret's at Cliffe. The detailed forecast is for a peak tide of 3.59m AoD at Dover at 10:45am. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Trent for riverside areas from Gainsborough to the Humber confluence

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, Lincolnshire, North Lincolnshire, Nottinghamshire

items.message:
High tides over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06:45 - 07:15 on Thursday morning (06/11) and  06:45 - 07:15 on Friday morning (07/11). 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides, strong winds and large waves today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 17:15 to 19:30 on 05/11/2025 
The forecast high water is at 18:15 on 05/11/2025 and the forecast tide level is 6.60 mAOD. The forecast wind is Force 5 South Easterly. 
Further flooding is possible with the next tide at 06.45 on 06/11/2025 as the forecast tide levels remain high at 6.56mAOD, however wind speeds are expected to drop to Force 2.  				 

Please note all tide times are in local time and refer to the high water time at Hinkley Point.

Flooding is forecast to affect low lying land, roads and paths, particularly around the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update the message as the situation changes. 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Consider activating any flood protection products you may have 
This message will be updated by 12:04PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Risk of spray and wave over-topping of quaysides, harbours and low lying land, roads and car parks. Communities most at risk include Port Quinn, Port Isaac, Port Gaverne and Bude. 
The high tide at Padstow on Wednesday 5 November evening is at 16:52pm. The forecast total high tide level is 4.60mAOD. Times of high water will vary along the coast.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Lizard Point to Gribbin Head excluding the Tidal Fal Estuary
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding today.  
Flooding is expected 2 hours either side of high tide on Wednesday pm tide and Thursday am tide.  
Locations most affected are Cadgwith, Coverack, Swanpool, Portmellon, Pentewan, St.Mawes, East Portholland, Mevagissey, Polmear/Par, Polkerris. High tide at Falmouth on Wednesday 5th is 4:46pm and Thursday 6th at 5:06am. Forecast total high tide level is 2.85mAOD and 2.76mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.3 metres above tide table level. Force 4 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.5m are forecast over Wednesday pm tide, easing to Force 3 Easterly and offshore wave heights of 1.8m on Thursday am tide. Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday pm tide  
We are closely monitoring the situation .  
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded   
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is expected 2 hours either side of high tide on Wednesday evening .  
Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded in Falmouth, Penryn, Flushing, Mylor Bridge, the A39 at Perranarworthal, Devoran and A390 at Tresillian. High tide at Falmouth on Wednesday is 4:46pm. Forecast total high tide level is 2.85mAOD. Expect tide levels to be around 0.3m above tide table level. Force 4 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.5m are forecast on Wednesday. Coastal conditions should ease by Thursday am tide.  
We are closely monitoring the situation .  
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded .  
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be Fowey, Lostwithiel, Polperro, Looe, Millendreath, B3247 at Seaton.

Expect tide levels to be around 0.4m above tide table level. items.description: Poole Harbour at West Quay and Lower Hamworthy Quay
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding this evening.  
Flooding is expected from 6:57pm to 10:57pm on 05/11/25.  
Areas most at risk include Lower Hamworthy and areas of Poole from Old Town, The Quay to Hunger Hill. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Poole of 1.41 mAODN at 8:57pm which is 0.37m above tide tables, with south easterly Force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 06/11/25 between 07:18am and 11:18am with a peak level of 1.41 mAODN at 09:18am with southernly Force 5 winds.  
We are closely monitoring the situation .  
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded .  
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 4:15pm to 8:15pm on 05/11/25. 
Areas most at risk include Weymouth Harbour and the tidal stretch of the River Wey, Commercial Road Car Park, Weymouth may be inaccessible .The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Weymouth Harbour of 1.85 mAODN at 6:15pm which is 0.35m above tide tables, with south easterly force 4 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 06/11/25 between 04:45am and 08:45am with a peak level of 1.87 mAODN at 06:45am with south easterly force 4 winds. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
High tides tomorrow afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM on Thursday 06/11/2025. The peak high water level is expected at 12:30 PM. 
Areas most at risk include low lying land, promenades and coastal footpaths. For those that need it, the forecast total peak water level at Sheerness is 3.54 m AOD.

High spring tides are expected to continue over the coming days so the risk of flooding may continue. We will update this Flood Alert message with subsequent high tides as necessary.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of high tide on Wednesday 05 November evening. 
Areas particularly at risk include Torbay, Teignmouth, Beesands, Torcross, Slapton and Dawlish. The high tide at Exmouth on Wednesday 5 November is at 6:30PM, times of high water will vary along the coast. Forecast total high tide level is 2.56mAOD, which is 0.39metres above tide table level. Force 4 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 1.40m are forecast over the high tide. Coastal conditions should ease for Thursday morning's high tide.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 12:30PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: The Solent, Portsmouth Harbour, Langstone Harbour

items.message:
High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.28 m. Total forecast tide is 5.41 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Overtopping of the sea wall into the garden of the Still and West Pub, Old Portsmouth is expected. The road will flood at East Street and impact boat yards at The Camber. The tidal defence gates at Old Portsmouth will be closed. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.49 mAOD). 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.28 m. Total forecast tide is 5.41 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. In Portchester, water will be high up slipways and spray overtopping of sea defence walls is expected. Debris and shingle could affect the A27 Southampton Road. Up to 0.1m of water will flood the lower end of Wallington Shore Road. At Lower Quay, and Eastern Parade (Fareham) water will come close to property. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.49 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

The weather increases tide table values by 0.28 m. Total forecast tide is 5.41 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. Overtopping into the coastal roads between Hillhead and Gosport is expected. Road flooding is expected on the eastern side of Gosport at Park Road, Parham and Ferrol Road. Property flooding is not expected. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.49 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We continue to monitor the situation.  Do not walk or drive through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 6th November 2025.

Derwent Water Levels remain high.  Keswick Campsite will be the main location affected. The weather is turning more settled for a time, compared with recent days and levels will continue to drop slowly.  We expect this warning to be in force until Friday morning, 7 November 2025. We continue to monitor the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Thursday morning's tide at 11:15 on 06/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.28 m. Total forecast tide is 5.41 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Easterly Force 4 wind. The main road at Northney will flood. At South Hayling, strong winds and large waves, will move and may remove shingle from the beach. This may cause garden and road flooding at Southwood Road, Bembridge Drive, Meath Close and The Strand. Thursday's tide at 23:30 on 06/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.49 mAOD). 
We are closing flood gates . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Greta at Keswick, Keswick Campsite, Rugby Club and Quinta
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. Although there is rain forecast for this morning, which will see the river rise slightly, it is forecast to stay below the flood warning thresholds 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Ehen at Egremont, Bleach Green, Ennerdale Mill, Bridge End, Vale View, Wood Bank, Rugby Club
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. The rainfall this morning will cause an increase in the river levels but we are not expecting them to reach the flood warning threshold again 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Rivers Cocker and Derwent at Cockermouth, Cricket Ground, Trout Hotel Car Park, Hatters Croft
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

The weather is turning more settled for a time, compared with recent days.  River levels are falling, lake levels remain high but are expected to fall slowly over the next few days.

Locations most affected will be the river Crake Valley, including Low Nibthwaite, Lowick Bridge, Spark Bridge and Penny Bridge.

We continue to monitor the situation .

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
